nodes.bodyText: Is it a typo? If it "should be activated by default", why the default value is false

No, it isn't. Based on the comments
Activated as the DASHBOARD type, makes this template added into the UI page automatically.
False means providing a basic template, user needs to add it manually.
@wu-sheng this should be fixed too, it's a copy-paste mistake
just curious why the name is disable instead of disabled, if the export/import features are done, does it work then? the query returns disabled, here you're expecting disable
I changed it to disabled.
I changed it to disabled.
The || operation on series != null and series.getValues().size() == 0 is somewhat confusing, is it a mistake?
@dmsolr I changed this to if (series == null || series.getValues().size() == 0) {, please confirm.

@dmsolr I changed this to if (series == null || series.getValues().size() == 0) {, please confirm.

I am afraid that it should be if (series != null && series.getValues().size() > 0), this is to check whether the management data already exists
Done though cellphone. Hope I have luck.
Just to name a few, these code styles are obviously not what we set in the codeStyle.xml, I believe one of you may loss the code style settings in the IDE
I don't know why, but the CI doesn't report in both ways.

I don't know why, but the CI doesn't report in both ways.

CI never reports this kind of styles, we have many existed codes that don't follow the styles yet, just wanted to remind that the settings may be lost in your local machine,
I think we should verify through the queryAll. Status could be fake :)
The field is better named successful (or something similar) IMO, based on its type boolean

nodes.bodyText: That needs to change in the GraphQL level. But to be honest, the status = true/false is very common in the skywalking as an expression. Check all sources, such as org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.core.source.Service#status.

nodes.bodyText: Seems this case depends on addUITemplate, it's a bad idea that one test case depends on another, please add an individual template in this case for testing modification (changeTemplate), BTW, I'm wondering whether updateTemplate in the backend query plugin is better or not, update is more widely used in the CRUD operations @wu-sheng change is somewhat Chinglish

I don't want to discuss about the language culture thing, as these two words are not that different. You could argue about add, insert or create too. As creating is a part of CRUD.
The point is, unless we want to set up term rules in order to keep all names consistent in the project, don't know how to say which one is better.
getProfileTaskDAO  this is another copy-and-paste mistake @wu-sheng
Fixed.
